metadata.titleEn: HiWATER: Dataset of fractional vegetation cover and biomass observed in the middle of Heihe River Basin (2013)
metadata.titleCn: 黑河生态水文遥感试验：黑河流域中游覆盖度和生物量观测数据集（2013）
metadata.description:
The dataset includes the fractional vegetation cover data generated from the stations of crop land, wetland, Gebi desert and desert steppe in Yingke Oasis and biomass data generated from the stations of crop land (corn) and wetland. The observations lasted for a vegetation growth cycle from 19 May, 2012 to 15 September, 2012.
1.	Fractional vegetation cover observation
1.1	Observation time
1.1.1	Station of the crop land: The observations lasted from 20 May, 2012 to 15 September, 2012, and in five-day periods for each observation before 31 July and in ten-day periods for each observation after 31 July.
The observation time for the station of crop land (corn) are 2013-5-20, 2013-5-25, 2013-5-30, 2013-6-5, 2013-6-10, 2013-6-16, 2013-6-22, 2013-6-27, 2013-7-2, 2013-7-7, 2013-7-12, 2013-7-17, 2013-7-27, 2013-8-3, 2013-8-13, 2013-8-25, 2013-9-5 and 2013-9-15.
1.1.2	The other four stations: The observations lasted from 20 May, 2012 to 15 September, 2012 and in ten-day periods for each observation.
The observation time for the crop land are 2013-5-20, 2013-6-5, 2013-6-16, 2013-6-27, 2013-7-7, 2013-7-17, 2013-7-27, 2013-8-3, 2013-8-13, 2013-8-25, 2013-9-5 and 2013-9-15.
1.2	method
1.2.1 Instruments and measurement method
Digital photography measurement is implemented to measure the FVC. Plot positions, photographic method and data processing method are dedicatedly designed. In field measurements, a long stick with the camera mounted on one end is beneficial to conveniently measure various species of vegetation, enabling a larger area to be photographed with a smaller field of view. The stick can be used to change the camera height; a ﬁxed-focus camera can be placed at the end of the instrument platform at the front end of the support bar, and the camera can be operated by remote control.
1.2.2 Design of the samples
Three and two plots with the area of 10×10 m^2 were measured for the station of the crop land and wetland, respectively. One plot with the area of 10×10 m^2 was measured for the other three stations. Shoot 9 times along two perpendicularly crossed rectangular-belt transects. The picture generated of each time is used to calculate a FVC value. “True FVC” of the plot is then acquired as the average of these 9 FVC values.
1.2.3 Photographic method
The photographic method used depends on the species of vegetation and planting pattern. A long stick with the camera mounted on one end is used for the stations of crop land and wetland. For the station of the crop land, rows of more than two cycles should be included in the ﬁeld of view (<30), and the side length of the image should be parallel to the row. If there are no more than two complete cycles, then information regarding row spacing and plant spacing are required. The FVC of the entire cycle, that is, the FVC of the quadrat, can be obtained from the number of rows included in the field of view. For other three stations, the photos of FVC were obtained by directly photographing for the lower heights of the vegetation.
1.2.4 Method for calculating the FVC
The FVC calculation was implemented by the Beijing Normal University. The detail method can be found in the reference below. Many methods are available to extract the FVC from digital images, and the degree of automation and the precision of identification are important factors that affect the efficiency of field measurements. This method, which is proposed by the authors, has the advantages of a simple algorithm, a high degree of automation and high precision, as well as ease of operation (see the reference).
2. Biomass observation
2.1. Observation time
2.1.1 Station of the crop land: The observations lasted from 20 May 2012 to 15 September 2012, and in five-day periods for each observation before 31 July and in ten-day periods for each observation after 31 July.
The observation time for the crop land are 2013-5-25, 2013-5-30, 2013-6-5, 2013-6-10, 2013-6-16, 2013-6-22, 2013-6-27, 2013-7-2, 2013-7-7, 2013-7-12, 2013-7-17, 2013-7-27, 2013-8-3, 2013-8-13, 2013-8-25, 2013-9-5 and 2013-9-15.
2.1.2 The station of wetland: The observations lasted from 20 May 2012 to 15 September 2012, and in ten-day periods for each observation.
The observation time for the crop land are 2013-6-5, 2013-6-16, 2013-6-27, 2013-7-7, 2013-7-17, 2013-7-27, 2013-8-3, 2013-8-13, 2013-8-25, 2013-9-5 and 2013-9-15.
2.2. Method
Station of the crop land: Three plots were selected and three strains of corn for each observation were random selected for each plot to measure the fresh weight (the aboveground biomass and underground biomass) and dry weight. Per unit biomass can be obtained according to the planting structure.
Station of the wetland: Two plots of reed with the area of 0.5 m × 0.5 m were random selected for each observation. The reed of the two plots was cut to measure the fresh weight (the aboveground biomass) and dry weight.
2.3. Instruments
Balance (accuracy 0.01 g); drying oven
3. Data storage
All observation data were stored in excel. Other data including plant spacing, row spacing, seeding time, irrigation time, the time of cutting male parent and the harvest time of the corn for the station of cropland were also stored in the excel.
metadata.descriptionCn:
本数据包括大满超级站、湿地、沙漠、荒漠和戈壁五个站点植被一个生长周期内的覆盖度数据集以及大满超级站玉米和湿地芦苇两种植被一个生长周期内的生物量数据集。观测时间自2013年5月19日开始，9月15日结束。
1覆盖度观测
1.1观测时间
1.1.1超级站：观测时间段2013年5月20日-9月15日， 7月31日以前每5天观测一次，7月31后每10天观测一次，共做了18次观测，具体观测时间如下；
超级站：2013-5-20、2013-5-25、2013-5-30、2013-6-5、2013-6-10、2013-6-16、2013-6-22、2013-6-27、2013-7-2、2013-7-7、2013-7-12、2013-7-17、2013-7-27、2013-8-3、2013-8-13、2013-8-25、2013-9-5、2013-9-15
1.1.2其它四个站：观测时间段2013年5月20日-9月15日，每10天观测一次，共做了12次观测，具体观测时间如下；
其它四个站：2013-5-20、2013-6-5、2013-6-16、2013-6-27、2013-7-7、2013-7-17、2013-7-27、2013-8-3、2013-8-13、2013-8-25、2013-9-5、2013-9-15
1.2观测方法
1.2.1测量仪器与原理：
采用数码相机拍照的方法测量，将数码相机置于简易支撑杆前端的仪器平台，保持拍摄的竖直向下，远程控制相机测量数据。观测架可以用来改变相机的拍摄高度，面向不同类型植被实现有针对性的测量。
1.2.2样方的设计
超级站：共取3块样地，每块样地样方大小10×10米，每样地每次测量时沿两条对角线依次拍照，共取9-10张照片；
湿地站：共取2块样地，每块样地样方大小10×10米，每样地每次测量拍9-10张照片；
其它3个站：选取1块样地，每块样地样方大小10×10米，每样地每次测量拍9-10张照片；
1.2.3拍摄方法
针对超级站玉米和湿地站芦苇，直接采用观测架观测，保证观测架上的相机距离植被冠层的高度远大于植被冠幅，在方形样方内沿着对角线采样，然后做算术平均。在视场角度不大(<30°)的情况下，视场内包括大于2个整周期的垄行，相片的边长与垄行平行；其它三个站点由于植被比较低矮，直接用相机垂直向下拍照（未使用支架）。
1.2.4 覆盖度计算
覆盖度计算由北京师范大学完成，采用一种自动分类方法，具体见 “建议参考文献”第1条文献。通过RGB颜色空间转换到更容易区分绿色植被的Lab空间，对绿度分量a的直方图进行聚类，分离出绿色植被和非绿色背景2组分，获得单张相片的植被覆盖度。该方法的优点在于其算法简单、易于实现而且自动化程度和精度较高。今后还需要更多的快速、自动、准确的分类方法，最大限度发挥数码相机方法的优势。
2生物量观测
2.1观测时间
2.1.1玉米：观测时间段2013年5月20日-9月15日， 7月31日以前每5天观测一次，7月31后每10天观测一次，共做了18次观测，具体观测时间如下；
玉米：2013-5-20、2013-5-25、2013-5-30、2013-6-5、2013-6-10、2013-6-16、2013-6-22、2013-6-27、2013-7-2、2013-7-7、2013-7-12、2013-7-17、2013-7-27、2013-8-3、2013-8-13、2013-8-25、2013-9-5、2013-9-15
2.1.2芦苇：观测时间段2013年5月20日-9月15日，每10天观测一次，共做了12次观测，具体观测时间如下；
芦苇：2013-5-20、2013-6-5、2013-6-16、2013-6-27、2013-7-7、2013-7-17、2013-7-27、2013-8-3、2013-8-13、2013-8-25、2013-9-5、2013-9-15
2.2观测方法
玉米：选取3块样地，每块样地每次观测选取代表样地平均水平的三株玉米分别称每株玉米的鲜重（地上生物量+地下生物量）和相应的干重（85℃恒温烘干），根据种植的株距和行距计算单位面积玉米的生物量；
芦苇：设置2个0.5mÍ0.5m的样方，齐地刈割，分别称取芦苇的鲜重（茎叶）和干重（85℃恒温烘干）。
2.3观测仪器
天平（精度0.01g）、烘箱。
3数据的存储
所有观测数据先手薄记录后整理到Excel表中存储，同时整理了玉米种植结构数据，包括种植的株距、行距，种植时间、灌水时间、除父本时间以及收割时间等相关信息。

background: Upscaling of eco-hydrological processes on a heterogeneous surface is a grand challenge. Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations. HiWATER is an experiment designed to address this challenge through instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales to obtain multiscale and multidisciplinary data.
challenges: Progress in this field is hindered by the poor availability of multiscale observations.
methods: Several intensive observation periods (IOPs) and continuous hydrometeorological observations were carried out during HiWATER. Only data collected during the IOP in 2012 are presented in this paper. Instruments for the oasis-desert system were arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multi-scale eco-hydrological processes. We established a sparse network to investigate the oasis-desert interaction. One superstation was constructed within the oasis, and four EC towers and four two-layer automatic meteorological stations (AMSs) were installed in different landscapes surrounding the oasis, including sandy desert, desert pavement, desert steppe, and wetland. Intensive observations were implemented at the irrigation district scale. A total of 12 airborne remote sensing missions were conducted to cover the FEA using LiDAR, an imaging spectrometer, a multi-angle thermal imager, and an L-band microwave radiometer.
dataset: We introduce a multiscale dataset obtained from Heihe Watershed Allied Telemetry Experimental Research (HiWATER) in an oasis-desert area in 2012. The HiWATER observation system consists of a flux observation matrix of eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations; an eco-hydrological sensor network of soil moisture and leaf area index; hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing using LiDAR, imaging spectrometer, multi-angle thermal imager, and L-band microwave radiometer; and synchronical ground measurements of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes. All observational data were carefully quality controlled throughout sensor calibration, data collection, data processing, and datasets generation. The data are freely available at figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre.
backgroundCn: 生态水文过程在异质表面上的上升尺度是一个重大挑战。该领域的进展受到多尺度观测数据稀缺的制约。HiWATER实验旨在通过在分层嵌套尺度上进行仪器布置，以获取多尺度和多学科的数据，从而解决这一挑战。
challengesCn: 该领域的进展受到多尺度观测稀缺的阻碍。
methodsCn: 在HiWATER期间进行了几次密集观测期（IOPs）和连续的水文气象观测。本文仅呈现2012年IOP期间收集的数据。为了捕捉多尺度生态水文过程，绿洲-沙漠系统的仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行布置。我们建立了一个稀疏网络，以研究绿洲-沙漠的相互作用。在绿洲内建造了一个超级站，并在绿洲周围不同的景观中安装了四个EC塔和四个两层自动气象站（AMS），这些景观包括沙漠、沙漠铺装、沙漠草原和湿地。在灌溉区尺度上实施了密集观测。共进行了12次空中遥感任务，使用了LiDAR、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计覆盖FEA。
datasetCn: 我们介绍了一个多尺度数据集，该数据集来自2012年在绿洲-沙漠地区进行的黑河流域联合遥测实验研究（HiWATER）。HiWATER观测系统由涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站组成的通量观测矩阵；土壤湿度和叶面积指数的生态水文传感器网络；使用激光雷达、成像光谱仪、多角度热成像仪和L波段微波辐射计的超高分辨率航空遥感；以及同步的植被动态和光合作用过程的地面测量。所有观测数据在传感器校准、数据收集、数据处理和数据集生成过程中都经过了严格的质量控制。这些数据可在figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心免费获取。

Example.QuestionEn: Can you provide an example of how digital cameras are utilized for vegetation coverage data collection in eco-hydrological experiments?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个数字相机如何在生态水文实验中用于植被覆盖数据收集的例子？
Example.AnswerEn: In the 黑河生态水文遥感试验, digital cameras are used to capture images for vegetation coverage measurement. The cameras are placed on a simple support rod, pointing vertically downwards, and operated remotely. This method allows for targeted measurement across different vegetation types by adjusting the camera height. Coverage is calculated by classifying images into green vegetation and non-green background using an automated method that converts RGB to Lab color space.
Example.AnswerCn: 在黑河生态水文遥感试验中，数字相机用于捕捉图像以测量植被覆盖率。相机放置在一个简单的支撑杆上，垂直向下拍摄，并通过远程操作。这种方法通过调整相机高度，允许针对不同植被类型进行有针对性的测量。覆盖率通过将图像分类为绿色植被和非绿色背景来计算，使用一种自动化方法将RGB转换为Lab颜色空间。

Example.QuestionEn: What is an example of a method used to measure biomass in different vegetation types during an ecological experiment?
Example.QuestionCn: 在生态实验中，用于测量不同植被类型生物量的一种方法是什么？
Example.AnswerEn: In the 黑河生态水文遥感试验, biomass is measured using different methods for corn and reeds. For corn, representative plants are selected, and their fresh and dry weights are measured to calculate biomass per unit area. For reeds, samples are cut from designated plots, and their fresh and dry weights are measured. Weighing is done using a balance with precision to 0.01g, and drying is performed at 85°C to obtain dry weight.
Example.AnswerCn: 在黑河生态水文遥感试验中，玉米和芦苇的生物量采用不同的方法进行测量。对于玉米，选择代表性植物，测量其鲜重和干重，以计算单位面积的生物量。对于芦苇，从指定样地中剪取样本，测量其鲜重和干重。称重使用精度为0.01克的天平，干燥在85°C下进行，以获得干重。

Example.QuestionEn: Could you provide an example of how multiscale datasets are constructed to study eco-hydrological processes in an oasis-desert environment?
Example.QuestionCn: 您能否提供一个示例，说明如何构建多尺度数据集以研究绿洲-沙漠环境中的生态水文过程？
Example.AnswerEn: In the HiWATER experiment, a multiscale dataset is created using a combination of flux observation matrices with eddy covariance towers, large aperture scintillometers, and automatic meteorological stations, alongside an eco-hydrological sensor network for soil moisture and leaf area index measurements. Airborne remote sensing with LiDAR, imaging spectrometers, and other instruments complements ground measurements, forming a comprehensive dataset for studying eco-hydrological processes.
Example.AnswerCn: 在HiWATER实验中，利用涡度协方差塔、大孔径闪烁仪和自动气象站的通量观测矩阵，结合生态水文传感器网络（用于土壤湿度和叶面积指数测量），创建了一个多尺度数据集。空中遥感技术（如激光雷达、成像光谱仪和其他仪器）补充了地面测量，形成了一个全面的数据集，用于研究生态水文过程。

Feature Specification.QuestionEn: What are the characteristics of the data collection methods used for measuring vegetation coverage in remote sensing experiments?
Feature Specification.QuestionCn: 用于测量遥感实验中植被覆盖的数据显示方法的特征是什么？
Feature Specification.AnswerEn: digital camera, vertical downward shooting angle, remote-controlled data capture, adjustable camera height, fixed plot design, 10x10 meter plots, photos taken along plot diagonals, automatic classification method, Lab color space, high degree of automation, accuracy
Feature Specification.AnswerCn: 数码相机，垂直向下拍摄角度，遥控数据采集，可调节相机高度，固定样地设计，10x10米样地，沿样地对角线拍摄照片，自动分类方法，Lab颜色空间，高度自动化，准确性。

Quantification.QuestionEn: How many observation periods were conducted for coverage data collection in the specified dataset?
Quantification.QuestionCn: 在指定的数据集中，进行了多少个观察期以收集覆盖数据？

Definition.QuestionEn: What does 'coverage observation' entail in the context of eco-hydrological data collection?
Definition.QuestionCn: 在生态水文数据收集的背景下，“覆盖观察”涉及什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: In the context of eco-hydrological data collection, 'coverage observation' involves using digital cameras to capture images for measuring vegetation coverage. The method includes placing the camera on an instrument platform attached to a support pole, ensuring vertical downward shooting, and remotely controlling the camera to collect data. This setup allows for targeted measurement depending on vegetation type, with a designed sample plot for photo capturing along diagonals to calculate average coverage.
Definition.AnswerCn: 在生态水文数据收集的背景下，“覆盖观察”涉及使用数码相机拍摄图像以测量植被覆盖率。该方法包括将相机放置在附加到支撑杆上的仪器平台上，确保垂直向下拍摄，并远程控制相机进行数据收集。此设置允许根据植被类型进行有针对性的测量，设计样本地块沿对角线拍摄照片以计算平均覆盖率。

Definition.QuestionEn: What is the significance of 'biomass observation' in assessing ecosystem dynamics?
Definition.QuestionCn: “生物量观测”在评估生态系统动态中的重要性是什么？
Definition.AnswerEn: Biomass observation is significant in assessing ecosystem dynamics as it involves measuring the fresh and dry weight of vegetation, such as corn and reeds, to calculate biomass per unit area. This process includes selecting representative plants or plots, weighing them, and using specific measurements like plant spacing to determine biomass. It provides crucial data on vegetation growth and productivity, which are key indicators of ecosystem health and dynamics.
Definition.AnswerCn: 生物量观测在评估生态系统动态中具有重要意义，因为它涉及测量植被（如玉米和芦苇）的鲜重和干重，以计算单位面积的生物量。这个过程包括选择代表性的植物或样地，称重，并使用植物间距等特定测量来确定生物量。它提供了关于植被生长和生产力的关键数据，这些都是生态系统健康和动态的重要指标。

Comparison.QuestionEn: How do the data collection methods for vegetation coverage using digital cameras compare to multiscale eco-hydrological observations in terms of instrumentation and scale?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 使用数码相机进行植被覆盖数据收集的方法与多尺度生态水文观测在仪器和尺度方面有何比较？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for vegetation coverage involve using digital cameras placed on instrument platforms to capture images for coverage calculation, with a focus on small-scale, targeted vegetation measurements. In contrast, multiscale eco-hydrological observations employ a variety of instruments, including eddy covariance towers and remote sensing tools, to capture processes at multiple scales, from individual plant dynamics to landscape-level interactions.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 植被覆盖的数据收集方法涉及使用放置在仪器平台上的数字相机捕捉图像以计算覆盖率，重点是小规模、针对性的植被测量。相比之下，多尺度生态水文观测采用多种仪器，包括涡度协方差塔和遥感工具，以捕捉从单个植物动态到景观级别相互作用的多个尺度过程。

Comparison.QuestionEn: What are the differences in observation frequency and data granularity between the vegetation coverage and biomass data collection and the intensive observation periods of eco-hydrological processes?
Comparison.QuestionCn: 植被覆盖和生物量数据收集的观测频率和数据粒度与生态水文过程的强化观测期之间有什么区别？
Comparison.AnswerEn: The vegetation coverage and biomass data collection is conducted at fixed intervals, with observations every 5 to 10 days, providing detailed temporal data for specific vegetation sites. In contrast, intensive observation periods for eco-hydrological processes involve continuous data collection across multiple instruments, capturing a broad range of temporal and spatial scales, potentially offering a more comprehensive dataset but with less frequent, individual site-specific detail.
Comparison.AnswerCn: 植被覆盖和生物量数据的收集是在固定的时间间隔内进行的，每5到10天观察一次，为特定植被地点提供详细的时间数据。相比之下，生态水文过程的密集观察期涉及跨多个仪器的连续数据收集，捕捉广泛的时间和空间尺度，可能提供更全面的数据集，但在个别地点的具体细节上频率较低。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: What data collection methods can be inferred or developed to enhance the accuracy of vegetation cover assessment in heterogeneous landscapes?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 可以推断或开发哪些数据收集方法，以提高对异质景观中植被覆盖评估的准确性？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The field utilizes digital camera photography combined with remote control and automated classification algorithms to accurately measure vegetation cover. This suggests that methods focusing on digital imaging and automated data processing can enhance accuracy.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 该领域利用数码相机摄影结合遥控和自动分类算法来准确测量植被覆盖。这表明，专注于数字成像和自动数据处理的方法可以提高准确性。

Interpretation.QuestionEn: How does the multiscale observation approach address the challenges of capturing eco-hydrological processes in diverse environments?
Interpretation.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测方法如何应对在多样环境中捕捉生态水文过程的挑战？
Interpretation.AnswerEn: The multiscale observation approach involves using a variety of instruments across different nested scales, which captures eco-hydrological processes effectively. This method integrates eddy covariance towers, meteorological stations, and remote sensing tools to gather comprehensive data in diverse environments.
Interpretation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测方法涉及在不同嵌套尺度上使用多种仪器，有效捕捉生态水文过程。该方法整合了涡度协方差塔、气象站和遥感工具，以在多样化环境中收集全面数据。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: What factors influence the frequency and timing of vegetation coverage observations in eco-hydrological studies?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 影响生态水文研究中植被覆盖观测频率和时机的因素有哪些？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: The frequency and timing of vegetation coverage observations are influenced by the growth cycles of the vegetation being studied. For example, during the growth period from May to September, observations were made every 5 days until the end of July and every 10 days afterward. These intervals are determined by the need to capture significant changes in vegetation coverage over time.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 植被覆盖观测的频率和时间受到所研究植被生长周期的影响。例如，在5月至9月的生长期间，观察每5天进行一次，直到7月底，之后每10天进行一次。这些间隔是为了捕捉植被覆盖随时间变化的显著变化。

Causal Antecedent.QuestionEn: Why is digital photography used as a data collection method for vegetation coverage in eco-hydrological research?
Causal Antecedent.QuestionCn: 数字摄影被用作生态水文学研究中植被覆盖数据收集方法的原因是什么？
Causal Antecedent.AnswerEn: Digital photography is used because it allows for targeted measurement of vegetation coverage by providing a visual and quantifiable method to capture data. The technique involves placing a digital camera on a platform to take vertically downward photos, which are then analyzed to determine vegetation coverage. This method is simple, automated, and provides high accuracy in distinguishing vegetation from the background.
Causal Antecedent.AnswerCn: 数字摄影被广泛使用，因为它提供了一种可视化和量化的方法来捕捉数据，从而实现对植被覆盖的针对性测量。该技术涉及将数码相机放置在一个平台上，向下垂直拍摄照片，然后对这些照片进行分析以确定植被覆盖情况。这种方法简单、自动化，并且在区分植被与背景方面提供了高准确性。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the consequences of using digital cameras placed on adjustable platforms for measuring vegetation coverage?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 使用放置在可调平台上的数字相机测量植被覆盖度的后果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Using digital cameras on adjustable platforms allows for targeted measurement by adjusting the height based on vegetation type. This method ensures a vertical downward shot, enhancing precision and enabling automation in calculating vegetation coverage through color space transformation and clustering techniques.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 使用可调平台上的数字相机可以通过根据植被类型调整高度来进行针对性测量。这种方法确保了垂直向下拍摄，提高了精确度，并通过颜色空间转换和聚类技术实现了植被覆盖率计算的自动化。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: How does the adoption of a multiscale observation system affect the understanding of eco-hydrological processes in heterogeneous surfaces?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 多尺度观测系统的采用如何影响对异质表面生态水文过程的理解？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: The adoption of a multiscale observation system provides comprehensive data that captures eco-hydrological processes across different scales. This approach supports the investigation of interactions within oasis-desert systems and enhances the quality of data through hierarchical instrumentation and synchronization of various sensing technologies.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测系统的采用提供了全面的数据，捕捉了不同尺度上的生态水文过程。这种方法支持对绿洲-沙漠系统内相互作用的研究，并通过分层仪器和各种传感技术的同步提高了数据的质量。

Causal Consequence.QuestionEn: What are the potential outcomes of integrating ground measurements with hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing in environmental research?
Causal Consequence.QuestionCn: 将地面测量与高分辨率航空遥感相结合在环境研究中的潜在结果是什么？
Causal Consequence.AnswerEn: Integrating ground measurements with hyper-resolution airborne remote sensing results in a robust dataset that combines detailed local observations with broader spatial data. This integration improves the accuracy and reliability of eco-hydrological studies by providing multiscale insights and facilitating a better understanding of vegetation dynamics and photosynthesis processes.
Causal Consequence.AnswerCn: 将地面测量与高分辨率航空遥感结果相结合，形成了一个强大的数据集，结合了详细的局部观察和更广泛的空间数据。这种整合提高了生态水文研究的准确性和可靠性，通过提供多尺度的见解，促进了对植被动态和光合作用过程的更好理解。

Goal Orientation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to observe biomass and coverage data over a complete growth cycle for vegetation types like corn and reed?
Goal Orientation.QuestionCn: 为什么观察玉米和芦苇等植被类型在整个生长周期内的生物量和覆盖数据很重要？
Goal Orientation.AnswerEn: Observing biomass and coverage over a full growth cycle is crucial to understand the dynamics and development of vegetation, which can provide insights into ecosystem productivity and health over time.
Goal Orientation.AnswerCn: 观察生物量和覆盖度在整个生长周期中的变化，对于理解植被的动态和发展至关重要，这可以为生态系统的生产力和健康提供时间上的洞察。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What procedures are utilized to measure vegetation coverage using digital photography in eco-hydrological studies?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，利用数字摄影测量植被覆盖度的程序包括哪些步骤？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Digital photography is used to measure vegetation coverage by placing a digital camera on an instrument platform at the end of a simple support rod, ensuring vertical downward shooting. The camera is remotely controlled to capture data. The setup allows for changing the shooting height to target different types of vegetation. The coverage calculation involves converting RGB color space to Lab space to differentiate green vegetation from non-green backgrounds, using histogram clustering of the green component to calculate coverage.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数字摄影用于测量植被覆盖率，通过将数码相机放置在一个仪器平台上，固定在一个简单的支撑杆的末端，确保垂直向下拍摄。相机通过远程控制进行数据捕获。该设置允许改变拍摄高度，以针对不同类型的植被。覆盖率计算涉及将RGB颜色空间转换为Lab空间，以区分绿色植被和非绿色背景，使用绿色分量的直方图聚类来计算覆盖率。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: How is biomass data collected for different vegetation types, and what instruments are utilized in this process?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 不同植被类型的生物量数据是如何收集的，以及在这个过程中使用了哪些仪器？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Biomass data for corn and reed is collected by selecting sample plots and measuring fresh and dry weights. For corn, three representative plants are selected per plot, and both aboveground and underground biomass is measured using a balance with 0.01g precision. For reeds, two 0.5m x 0.5m plots are harvested at ground level, and fresh and dry weights are measured. A balance and an oven for drying at 85°C are used in the process.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 玉米和芦苇的生物量数据通过选择样本地块并测量鲜重和干重进行收集。对于玉米，每个地块选择三株代表性植物，使用精度为0.01克的天平测量地上和地下生物量。对于芦苇，收获两个0.5米 x 0.5米的地块，测量其鲜重和干重。整个过程使用天平和在85°C下干燥的烘箱。

Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionEn: What are the steps involved in ensuring data quality and consistency when collecting multiscale eco-hydrological data?
Instrumental/Procedural.QuestionCn: 在收集多尺度生态水文数据时确保数据质量和一致性的步骤是什么？
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerEn: Data quality and consistency are ensured through careful calibration of sensors, structured data collection methods, and thorough data processing. Instrumentation is arranged in hierarchically nested scales to capture multiscale processes, with consistent observations across various landscapes. Data is recorded initially in notebooks and then organized into Excel spreadsheets, including metadata like planting structure and management details, ensuring a comprehensive and organized dataset.
Instrumental/Procedural.AnswerCn: 数据质量和一致性通过对传感器的精确校准、结构化的数据收集方法和彻底的数据处理得以确保。仪器按照层次嵌套的尺度进行安排，以捕捉多尺度过程，并在各种景观中进行一致的观察。数据最初记录在笔记本中，然后整理到Excel电子表格中，包括种植结构和管理细节等元数据，确保数据集的全面性和组织性。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What technological advancements have enabled the automatic classification of vegetation coverage from digital photographs in ecological water experiments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 哪些技术进步使得在生态水实验中能够从数字照片自动分类植被覆盖？
Enablement.AnswerEn: The automatic classification of vegetation coverage is enabled by converting RGB color space to the Lab color space, where green vegetation can be more easily distinguished. This method utilizes clustering of the greenness component 'a' in the Lab space to separate green vegetation from non-green backgrounds.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 自动分类植被覆盖通过将RGB颜色空间转换为Lab颜色空间来实现，在Lab空间中，绿色植被更容易被区分。该方法利用Lab空间中绿色成分'a'的聚类，将绿色植被与非绿色背景分开。

Enablement.QuestionEn: What conditions or methods ensure the collection of reliable biomass data in ecological remote sensing experiments?
Enablement.QuestionCn: 确保生态遥感实验中可靠生物量数据收集的条件或方法有哪些？
Enablement.AnswerEn: Reliable biomass data collection is ensured by selecting representative samples from designated plots, weighing fresh and dry biomass, and using precise instruments like a balance with 0.01g accuracy and an oven for drying. These samples are then used to calculate biomass per unit area based on planting distances.
Enablement.AnswerCn: 可靠的生物量数据收集是通过从指定样地中选择代表性样本、称量新鲜和干燥生物量，以及使用精确仪器（如精度为0.01克的天平和用于干燥的烘箱）来确保的。这些样本随后用于根据种植距离计算单位面积的生物量。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why might the use of digital cameras for cover data collection in eco-hydrological studies be preferred over traditional measurement methods?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文研究中，使用数码相机进行覆盖数据收集可能比传统测量方法更受青睐的原因是什么？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The digital camera method allows for targeted measurements by changing the camera's shooting height and offers a simple, easy-to-implement algorithm for automatic classification with high precision. This method maximizes the advantages of digital cameras in capturing vegetation cover data.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 数字相机方法通过改变相机的拍摄高度实现了针对性的测量，并提供了一种简单、易于实施的算法，用于高精度的自动分类。这种方法最大限度地发挥了数字相机在捕捉植被覆盖数据方面的优势。

Expectation.QuestionEn: What challenges might arise from the lack of multiscale observations in eco-hydrological processes, and how does this impact expected research outcomes?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 缺乏多尺度观测在生态水文过程中的挑战是什么，这如何影响预期的研究结果？
Expectation.AnswerEn: The lack of multiscale observations hinders progress in understanding eco-hydrological processes on heterogeneous surfaces. This challenge affects expected research outcomes by limiting the ability to capture interactions across different landscape scales, which is crucial for comprehensive eco-hydrological modeling.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的缺乏阻碍了对异质表面生态水文过程的理解。这一挑战影响了预期的研究成果，因为它限制了捕捉不同景观尺度之间相互作用的能力，而这些相互作用对于全面的生态水文建模至关重要。

Expectation.QuestionEn: Why is it important to implement both sparse networks and intensive observations in eco-hydrological experiments, and what outcomes are anticipated from such an approach?
Expectation.QuestionCn: 在生态水文实验中实施稀疏网络和密集观测为何重要？这种方法预期会产生什么结果？
Expectation.AnswerEn: Implementing sparse networks alongside intensive observations allows for capturing interactions across different landscape scales, such as oasis-desert interactions. This approach is expected to provide a more comprehensive understanding of multiscale eco-hydrological processes, facilitating better data integration and analysis.
Expectation.AnswerCn: 实施稀疏网络与密集观测相结合，可以捕捉不同景观尺度之间的相互作用，例如绿洲-沙漠相互作用。这种方法预计将提供对多尺度生态水文过程的更全面理解，促进更好的数据整合和分析。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: In what ways could the challenges of limited multiscale observations impact the quality of eco-hydrological data collected in heterogeneous landscapes, such as oasis-desert systems?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 有限的多尺度观测挑战可能会如何影响在异质景观（如绿洲-沙漠系统）中收集的生态水文数据的质量？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: The limited availability of multiscale observations can significantly impact the quality of eco-hydrological data collected in heterogeneous landscapes by hindering the comprehensive understanding of complex processes. This can lead to gaps in capturing interactions across different spatial and temporal scales, ultimately affecting the reliability and applicability of the data for broader research and management purposes.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 多尺度观测的有限可用性可能会显著影响在异质景观中收集的生态水文数据的质量，因为它阻碍了对复杂过程的全面理解。这可能导致在不同空间和时间尺度上捕捉相互作用的空白，最终影响数据在更广泛研究和管理目的上的可靠性和适用性。

Judgmental.QuestionEn: What potential improvements can be made to the existing methods of biomass observation to enhance data accuracy and reliability in similar ecological studies?
Judgmental.QuestionCn: 可以对现有的生物质观测方法进行哪些潜在改进，以提高类似生态研究中的数据准确性和可靠性？
Judgmental.AnswerEn: Potential improvements to biomass observation methods could include the integration of advanced remote sensing technologies, such as LiDAR or multispectral imaging, to supplement ground-based measurements. Additionally, refining sampling techniques and incorporating more frequent and diverse data collection points could enhance the accuracy and reliability of biomass data in ecological studies.
Judgmental.AnswerCn: 对生物量观测方法的潜在改进可以包括整合先进的遥感技术，如激光雷达（LiDAR）或多光谱成像，以补充基于地面的测量。此外，优化采样技术并纳入更频繁和多样化的数据收集点，可以提高生态研究中生物量数据的准确性和可靠性。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I can't quite grasp how the use of digital cameras for measuring vegetation coverage ensures accuracy and automation in the data collection process.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我无法完全理解使用数码相机测量植被覆盖率如何确保数据收集过程的准确性和自动化。
Assertion.AnswerEn: The use of digital cameras involves taking vertical downward photos using a camera placed on a support platform, allowing for remote control of the camera for data measurement. The technique uses an automatic classification method, transforming RGB color space into Lab space, which helps distinguish green vegetation and calculate coverage. This method is noted for its simplicity, ease of implementation, high degree of automation, and precision in computing vegetation coverage.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 使用数码相机涉及将相机放置在支撑平台上，进行垂直向下拍摄，允许远程控制相机进行数据测量。该技术采用自动分类方法，将RGB色彩空间转换为Lab色彩空间，这有助于区分绿色植被并计算覆盖率。这种方法以其简单性、易于实施、高度自动化和计算植被覆盖率的精确性而受到认可。

Assertion.QuestionEn: I'm not sure how researchers manage to collect accurate biomass data of different vegetation types over an entire growing season.
Assertion.QuestionCn: 我不确定研究人员如何在整个生长季节内收集不同植被类型的准确生物量数据。
Assertion.AnswerEn: For biomass data collection, researchers select sample plots and measure fresh and dry weights of vegetation samples. For corn, they choose representative plants and measure fresh and dry biomass. For reeds, they use sample plots, harvest the vegetation, and weigh the biomass. The observations are recorded meticulously, and calculations are made based on planting distances to determine biomass per unit area.
Assertion.AnswerCn: 对于生物质数据收集，研究人员选择样本地块并测量植物样本的新鲜和干重。对于玉米，他们选择代表性植物并测量新鲜和干生物量。对于芦苇，他们使用样本地块，收获植被并称量生物量。观察结果被仔细记录，并根据种植距离进行计算，以确定单位面积的生物量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please explore and summarize the data collection methods used for observing vegetation coverage and biomass in the context of eco-hydrological experiments.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请探讨并总结在生态水文实验中用于观察植被覆盖和生物量的数据收集方法。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: The data collection methods for observing vegetation coverage and biomass involve using digital photography with a camera mounted on a simple support rod, capturing vertical downward images. The observation framework allows for adjusting the camera height to target different vegetation types. Coverage calculation utilizes an automatic classification method based on RGB to Lab color space transformation, enabling separation of green vegetation from the background. Biomass observation involves measuring fresh and dry weight of selected vegetation samples and calculating biomass per unit area.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 观察植被覆盖和生物量的数据收集方法包括使用安装在简单支撑杆上的相机进行数字摄影，捕捉垂直向下的图像。观察框架允许调整相机高度以针对不同的植被类型。覆盖计算利用基于RGB到Lab颜色空间转换的自动分类方法，能够将绿色植被与背景分离。生物量观察涉及测量选定植被样本的新鲜和干重，并计算单位面积的生物量。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please analyze the challenges associated with collecting multiscale eco-hydrological observation data and propose potential solutions.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 分析收集多尺度生态水文观测数据所面临的挑战，并提出潜在解决方案。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: One of the main challenges in collecting multiscale eco-hydrological observation data is the poor availability of multiscale observations. To address this, HiWATER implemented instrumentation on hierarchically nested scales, including superstations and EC towers, as well as multiple remote sensing missions using LiDAR and spectrometers to capture diverse eco-hydrological processes. Solutions could involve enhancing the spatial and temporal resolution of data collection and expanding the sensor network to cover more varied landscapes.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 收集多尺度生态水文观测数据的主要挑战之一是多尺度观测的可用性较差。为了解决这个问题，HiWATER在层次嵌套的尺度上实施了仪器，包括超级站和生态系统（EC）塔，以及多个遥感任务，使用激光雷达（LiDAR）和光谱仪来捕捉多样的生态水文过程。解决方案可能涉及增强数据收集的空间和时间分辨率，并扩大传感器网络以覆盖更多样化的景观。

Request/Directive.QuestionEn: Please identify and describe potential sources or repositories where relevant multiscale eco-hydrological datasets can be accessed.
Request/Directive.QuestionCn: 请识别和描述潜在的来源或库，以便访问相关的多尺度生态水文数据集。
Request/Directive.AnswerEn: Relevant multiscale eco-hydrological datasets can be accessed from repositories such as figshare and the Cold and Arid Regions Science Data Centre. HiWATER's data, which includes flux observation matrices, eco-hydrological sensor networks, and remote sensing data, are carefully quality controlled and made freely available through these platforms.
Request/Directive.AnswerCn: 相关的多尺度生态水文数据集可以从figshare和寒区与干旱区科学数据中心等数据仓库获取。HiWATER的数据包括通量观测矩阵、生态水文传感器网络和遥感数据，这些数据经过严格的质量控制，并通过这些平台免费提供。
